t: How*pn beautiful are your feet in sandals, O*ld noble daughter! Your*ln rounded thighs are like jewels, the*ld work of a master hand.
Your*ln navel is a rounded bowl that*ld never lacks mixed wine. Your*ln belly is a heap of wheat, encircled*ld with lilies.
Your*ln two breasts are like two fawns, twins*ld of a gazelle.
Your*ln neck is like an ivory tower. Your*ln eyes are pools in Heshbon, by*ld the gate of Bath-rabbim. Your*ln nose is like a tower of Lebanon, which*ld looks toward Damascus.
Your*ln head crowns you like Carmel, and*ld your flowing locks are like purple; a*ld king is held captive in the tresses.
How*pn beautiful and pleasant you are, O*ld loved one, with all your delights!
Your*ln stature is like a palm tree, and*ld your breasts are like its clusters.
I*ln say I will climb the palm tree and*ld lay hold of its fruit. Oh*ln may your breasts be like clusters of the vine, and*ld the scent of your breath like apples,
and*ln your mouth like the best wine.
It*pn goes down smoothly for my beloved, gliding*ld over lips and teeth.
I*pn am my belovedâ€™s, and*ld his desire is for me.
Come,*pn my beloved, let*ld us go out into the fields and*ld lodge in the villages;
let*ln us go out early to the vineyards and*ld see whether the vines have budded, whether*ln the grape blossoms have opened and*ld the pomegranates are in bloom. There*ln I will give you my love.
The*ln mandrakes give forth fragrance, and*ld beside our doors are all choice fruits, new*ln as well as old, which*ld I have laid up for you, O my beloved.
